description:
As the nations of the world begin to merge, world peace is threatened by the private armies of individual corporations. The Kuryu Group has just discovered a weapon that will tip world power in their favor. The Genocyber: a nightmarish combination of cybernetics and psychic potential. Many desire to control this monstrosity, but can its hatred be contained... Battle erupts, and the cyberpunk world of the future is about to explode with violence.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

node.description: Kouichi Oohata is a director and mecha designer best known for creating the Gunbuster from *Top wo Nerae!*

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/snjaramaki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒牧伸志) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinji_Aramaki)

Aramaki is one of the leading figures in the industry's CG animation, and is noted for his various design works in numerous anime series such as [Gasaraki](https://anilist.co/anime/782/), [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) among many others.

Influenced by [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/), [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), and Star Wars during his junior and senior high school years, he decided to pursue a career in film. One of his first representative works was an independently produced animation titled "Moonstruck Artemis," that he made while part of a manga club during his university days. Aramaki didn't have a special desire to work in the animation industry, but has stated joining it solely because he could draw and the industry had a wide range of options for someone like that. He has also said that the spread of digital technology has made it easier for him to work in both anime and live-action.

In 2004, Aramaki directed [Appleseed](https://anilist.co/anime/54/), a re-interpretation of a [Shirou Masamune](https://anilist.co/staff/97609/) manga by [the same name](https://anilist.co/manga/30668/). Although bashed by critics, the movie was an influential piece in the medium that had great impact on creators around the world. Studio Ghibli co-founder [Toshio Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101638/) said the movie would reform the industry.

__Skills & Abilities:__ Speaks fluent Japanese

Founder, Owner, and Managing Director of Central Park Media.

[Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/gilbertobaroli/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/gilberto_baroli/) | [Facebook 1](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.9) | [Facebook 2](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli) | [Facebook 3](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.5) | [Facebook 4](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.7)

Gilberto Pereira Baroli is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and translator. He is married to [Rosa Maria Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/180909/), father of [Hermes Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/100069/), [Luciana Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/106520/) and Hiram Baroli, stepfather of [Letícia Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/100136/) and grandfather of [Bruna Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/274698/), [Caio Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/262448/), Hiram Baroli Filho and [Gustavo Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/341902/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Papa Smurf (The Smurfs 1981 [1st dub], Les Schtroumpfs 2021, The Smurfs and the Magic Flute [2nd dub], My Smurfy Valentine, Smurfily Ever After [2nd dub], The Smurfs Christmas Special [2nd dub] and The Smurfs The Legend of Smurfy Hollow)
- Aurelion Sol, The Star Forger (League of Legends)
- Yoninin Dokussai (2nd voice - eps 17-50; Sekai Ninja Sen Jiraiya)
- Elementor (Max Steel franchise)
- Richard Harrison (Pawn Stars)
- Commander Yui Ibuki (Dengeki Sentai Changeman)
- Park Rick Marshall (1st dub; The Land of The Lost)
- Commander Sanjuurou Sugata (Hikari Sentai Maskman)
- Rampage / Protoform X (Beast Wars)
- Comissioner Francis "Frank" Reagan (2nd voice - 13th season onwards; Blue Bloods)
- Sr. Bullet (Mullet Mad Jack)
- Three-Eyed Raven (2nd voice - 6th season; Game of Thrones)
- Fulgor (Masters of the Universe: Revolution)
- Donkey Xote (Remigio Globus)
- Hades (Impérios AD)
- General Themes (Don't Look Up)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kixyuubann) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/神山健治)

He has worked regularly with the anime studio and production enterprise, Production I.G, such as his work on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/), Patlabor, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), and for whom he has directed the [Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/467/) anime series. In 2002 he made his directorial debut with [MiniPato](https://anilist.co/anime/2733/).

In 2007, he directed the TV series [Guardian of the Sacred Spirit](https://anilist.co/anime/1827/) and [Eden of the East](https://anilist.co/anime/5630/).

Started his career as a background artist.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Kouichi Oohata is a director and mecha designer best known for creating the Gunbuster from *Top wo Nerae!*

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%B5%9C%E4%B9%8B%E6%BE%A4%E4%BC%B8)

Shin Unozawa is a planner and producer.

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%B5%9C%E4%B9%8B%E6%BE%A4%E4%BC%B8)

Shin Unozawa is a planner and producer.
Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.
